Topic.Title: Its time to prepare to say goodbye

Posts.EditableText:
My computer had a huge difficulty turning on today, it took me four hours after pressing the ON button every ten minutes.

I am going to get enough money to buy a new one sometime in summer of 2018, so until then no games.

See you later.

EDIT: I just realized it is more appropriate to post this in general discussion but there seems to be no move button, so nevermind.

Posts.EditableText: you could have someone test your power supply component in your computer (generally they last about 5 years, whereas a/the computer/cars/any-electronic-device-or-vehicle-lol lasts 10 years), as it could just be your power supply component dying, and if it is, you can have someone physically install a new one (after buying it) for you, but getting a new computer is better (repairing a computer is often more expensive then getting a new better computer, aside from the hassle of updating the new computer with everything from your old computer, as well as compatibility issues with getting your old stuff to work on your new computer... if it can be done... as 'drivers' is what enables software to work with the hardware/computer, but drivers' coding and/or whatever else is needed is very advanced stuff (at least for me) that requires you to understand the computer system/OS, hardware, and programming very well. Or, the old software uses old services which are disabled on new computers as they're more vulnerable in terms of security, and/or they've designed better services.

Posts.EditableText:
Tiger direct... refurbished desktops, with OS... $100.00 (I think that is just the tower, no keyboard or screen)
Do you have a desktop or laptop???
I agree with the PS issue problem as a cause...

I leave mine running 24/7... 
Screen saver saves the screen, after 10 minutes, screen off after 30 minutes, never sleeps...
Always ready at the move of the mouse, or a key press...
